entry.summary: Bitcoin mining firm Phoenix Group announced the addition of 52 megawatts (MW) worth of mining capacity to its capabilities in Ethiopia. According to an April 29 announcement, with this latest addition, Phoenixâ€™s Bitcoin mining capacity in Ethiopia reaches 132 MW. The firmâ€™s global capacity now reportedly exceeds 500 MW. Phoenixâ€™s co-founder and CEO, Munaf Ali, said the firmâ€™s strategy relies on â€œsecuring prime locations with abundant, low-cost energy.â€ â€œInitiatives like our latest expansion in Ethiopia are pivotal steps, not only creating significant value today but also solidifying our position,â€ he said. Related: Arkansas city rejects crypto mining proposal after community pushback Building on previous agreements The news follows Phoenix Group signing an agreement that secures the right â€¦

entry.title: Zeno DB â€“ A Fresh Take on Offline-First Web Apps with Postgres Sync
entry.summary:
âš¡ What Is zeno-db?
zeno-db is a tiny but powerful library that handles client-side IndexedDB storage and syncs with a Postgres database on the backend â€” all in real time via WebSockets. It's perfect for: ðŸ“ Note-taking and journaling apps ðŸ“¦ Inventory or POS systems ðŸ§‘â€ðŸŒ¾ Field apps in low-connectivity areas ðŸ§ Any local-first, collaborative app âœ… Offline-first: Use IndexedDB directly in the browser ðŸ” Syncs to a remote PostgreSQL backend âš¡ Real-time updates using WebSockets ðŸ§¼ Zero dependencies ðŸ‘· Built with TypeScript You get the speed of local storage with the reliability of Postgres, all wrapped in a lightweight sync layer. Install with: npm install zeno-db
Example usage: import { ZenoClient } from 'zeno-db';
const db = new ZenoClient({ serverUrl: 'wss://myapp.com/socket', database: 'my_local_db', });
The client stores data locally, and when the network is available, it syncs everything seamlessly to your server. ðŸš§ Itâ€™s Beta â€” But Very Active
The project is in active development, and the authors are upfront: expect occasional breaking changes and limited docs (for now). But if youâ€™re an early adopter or building prototypes, itâ€™s a fantastic time to explore. ðŸ”„ How Does It Compare?
ðŸ§ Final Thoughts
zeno-db is a promising, low-overhead alternative for anyone building a local-first experience on top of a familiar Postgres stack. If youâ€™re tired of choosing between complex sync engines or vendor lock-in, give this a shot. ðŸ‘€ Whatâ€™s Next?
ðŸ”— NPM: zeno-db
ðŸ§ª Test it in your next PWA or internal tool
Thank you all

entry.title: Your digital identity got stolen â€” Now what?
entry.summary:
What is digital identity?
Your digital identity is the fingerprint you leave across the internet, a living map of who you are. Your digital identity is more than just your name or email; it stretches from your social media profiles and crypto wallet addresses to your device fingerprints and even the rhythms of your daily browsing habits. In the fast-moving world of cryptocurrency, where identity and financial access often overlap, digital identity theft isnâ€™t just a nuisance; itâ€™s an open door to your assets.Â
Without strong protection, even small pieces of stolen information can be stitched into a full profile, giving cybercriminals everything they need to impersonate you, seize your funds or lock you out of your accounts. What many donâ€™t realizeâ€¦

entry.title: Revolutionize Your Business with AI Chatbots
entry.summary:
How AI Chatbots Are Changing the Game (And Why Your Business Needs One)
Let's be real â€” in 2025, if you're not using an AI chatbot, you're already behind. Chatbots arenâ€™t just some techy trend anymore â€” theyâ€™re the secret weapon smart businesses are using to connect, sell, and support around the clock. Think of an AI chatbot as a virtual assistant thatâ€™s always awake, always polite, and never asks for a coffee break. â˜• No scripts. No boring robotic replies. The best bots actually talk like humans now. Cool, right? Hereâ€™s why youâ€™re seeing chatbots everywhere: Always Online: Your chatbot doesnâ€™t need sleep â€” itâ€™s available 24/7 for your customers. Save Big Money: Instead of hiring huge support teams, a single bot can handle hundreds (even thousands) of conversations at once. Instant Responses: No more customers waiting on hold or unanswered DMs. Feels Personal: Todayâ€™s bots can remember past conversations and make users feel like theyâ€™re chatting with a real person. And letâ€™s be honest â€” when customers get instant help, theyâ€™re way more likely to stick around and buy. ðŸ“ž Customer Service: Help people out without lifting a finger. ðŸ›’ Boost Sales: Recommend products and close more deals automatically. ðŸ“… Appointments: Let customers book meetings without back-and-forth emails. ðŸ“ˆ Lead Generation: Find your next big client through a casual chatbot convo. AI is moving fast â€” like, "blink and you'll miss it" fast. Experts believe that within just a few years, bots will handle about 90% of customer conversations. Itâ€™s simpler than you think: Decide what you need â€” Sales? Support? Lead generation? Pick a platform â€” There are tons of great ones like Dialogflow, ChatGPT, and Microsoft Bot Framework. Plan your conversations â€” Make it fun, helpful, and easy to use. Test and tweak â€” Your first version wonâ€™t be perfect. Thatâ€™s okay! âœ¨ At Aerobyte Innovations, we build custom chatbots that actually sound human (because boring bots are bad for business). Letâ€™s chat!

entry.title: Neurosell announces $800K seed round of investment to refine and scale Virton AI - fitting rooms for online stores
Building Future-Proof Themes with Performance in Mind
entry.summary: At ElectronThemes, weâ€™re all about building scalable and high-performance themes that not only look great but work seamlessly in real-world conditions. We leverage React, Next.js, Node.js, and Vue for frontend development. Using Tailwind CSS for utility-first styles and Liquid for flexible templating, we create themes that are both highly customizable and fast to deploy. We work with platforms like Ghost, WordPress, Shopify, Framer, Squarespace, and Webflow. Whether itâ€™s headless CMS integration or full-stack builds, we use a modular, component-driven approach to ensure clean and maintainable code. We focus on the core web vitals like: Lighthouse scores: Maximizing performance metrics for faster loading INP (Interaction to Next Paint): Ensuring smooth and responsive user interactions CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift): Delivering a stable experience without unexpected shifts We integrate GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Meta Pixel for real-time performance tracking, giving you the data needed to make informed optimizations. Our goal is to provide fast, modular, and scalable themes that work with your workflow, whether you're building static sites or complex dynamic systems. We keep performance at the forefront of everything we do. Looking for a future-proof theme for your next project? Whether you're using Ghost, Shopify, or WordPress, we can help you get started with a fast, optimized solution.

entry.title: Rails Action Mailer: Rendering Charts or Graphs in your Email
Rate Limit Handling: Using Randomized Delays with Cloud Tasks
entry.summary: As a developer, we often integrate with external API. There are a lot of consideration when working with external service such as API availability, latency, network failure, API timeout, and rate limit. We gonna talk about rate limit. It's a common design to handle and manage system load when exposing the API to external partner. From API's POV, we need to determine like how many request per second our API should handle, otherwise we will reject it to maintain the API latency and other performance metrics. If we talk from consumer POV, we will thing how our outbound request to the API pass the rate limit or how not to get caught by rate limiter. In low traffic application, it's not a problem, we wont hit the rate limit, but for mid - large scale traffic it might be an issue. In the use casâ€¦

entry.title: Loopscale recovers $2.8M after weekend DeFi hack and bounty talks
entry.summary: DeFi protocol Loopscale has recovered nearly half of the funds stolen during a major exploit over the weekend, as white hat negotiations with the attacker show signs of progress. In an April 29 update posted to X, Loopscale confirmed that approximately 19,463 Wrapped SOL (WSOL) (worth roughly $2.88 million) have been returned to its wallets since April 28. The first two returns included 10,000 WSOL (~$1.48 million) and 4,463 WSOL (~$660,000), following an earlier recovery of 5,000 WSOL (~$740,000). â€œOur pursuit of an amicable resolution regarding Saturdayâ€™s incident continues to make progress,â€ the team wrote. Loopscale updating community on negotiations progress. Source: Loopscale Related: DeFi platform KiloEx to compensate users impacted by $7.5M hack Loopscale offers 10% bounty for retuâ€¦

entry.summary: The founders of the crypto fintech firm Bankera used funds from the projectâ€™s 2018 initial coin offering to purchase luxury properties worldwide, according to a report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project. The OCCRP reported on April 28, citing leaked company records and bank statements, that nearly half of the funds from Bankeraâ€™s 100 million euro ($114 million) ICO were transferred to a bank in the Pacific Island country of Vanuatu that was purchased by the projectâ€™s founders, Vytautas KaraleviÄius, Justas Dobiliauskas and Mantas MockeviÄius. entry.title: Zurich Uniâ€™s secret AI experiment manipulated Redditorsâ€™ opinions
entry.summary: Researchers at the University of Zurich have been accused of undertaking an unauthorized four-month-long experiment on a Reddit board using artificial intelligence-generated comments to test whether AI could alter peopleâ€™s opinions.Â As part of the experiment, AI-powered accounts faked a variety of personas, including a rape victim, a person opposed to specific social movements and a trauma counselor specializing in abuse, moderators of the r/changemyview subreddit said in an April 26 post. â€œOur sub is a decidedly human space that rejects undisclosed AI as a core value,â€ the moderators said. â€œPeople do not come here to discuss their views with AI or to be experimented upon.â€Â The researchers used AI to generate responses but attempted to personalize the replies based on information from thâ€¦

entry.title: Samourai Wallet, feds ask for time to mull dropping crypto mixer case
entry.summary: US federal prosecutors and the co-founders of the crypto mixer Samourai Wallet have asked a court for more time to consider potentially dismissing the case after the Justice Department rolled back its crypto enforcement. Lawyers for Samourai Wallet CEO Keonne Rodriguez and chief technology officer William Hill said in an April 28 letter to Manhattan federal judge Richard Berman that they jointly requested with the government â€œfor a continuance of the pretrial motions schedule by 16 days.â€ The Samourai executives' lawyers said on April 10 that they wrote to Acting Manhattan US Attorney Jay Clayton to request the dismissal of the case after an April 7 memo from Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche shuttered the Justice Departmentâ€™s crypto team. â€œOn April 24, 2025, defense counsel met with thâ€¦

entry.title: US dollar facing growing competition for stablecoin dominance: Tether co-founder
entry.summary: While United States dollar-denominated stablecoins dominate the stablecoin and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization game, other competitors are coming into play, according to Tether co-founder Reeve Collins.Â Speaking to Cointelegraph in Dubai, Collins said that while dollar-backed stablecoins may be dominant, other currencies and assets may compete to back stablecoins. â€œThe stablecoin definitely helps preserve the dollar dominance, especially in the crypto space,â€ Collins said. â€œThe dollar is kind of the reserve currency of crypto. But now there are other currencies coming into play. But more importantly, itâ€™s not currencies. Itâ€™s other types of backing,â€ he added. Collins said that other assets used to back stablecoins may compete with US dollars by bringing a higher yield to users.Â Inteâ€¦

entry.title: Ray Dalio says global monetary order â€˜on the brinkâ€™ of breakdown
entry.summary: Legendary investor Ray Dalio has said the world is â€œon the brinkâ€ of the global monetary order breaking down, which is being accelerated by the Trump administrationâ€™s tariff disruptions. The trade tensions are fracturing the monetary, political and international world orders by fueling deglobalization and unsustainable trade imbalances, Dalio, the former CEO of hedge fund Bridgewater Associates, said in an April 28 X post. Dalio added that this is leading to irreversible damage, and an increasing number of importers and exporters, particularly between the US and China, are drastically reducing interdependencies and â€œmaking alternative plans.â€ â€œ[Theyâ€™re] recognizing that whatever happens with tariffs, these problems won't go away, and that radically reduced interdependencies with the US is â€¦

entry.title: Crypto group asks Trump to end prosecution of crypto devs, Roman Storm
entry.summary: The crypto lobby group, the DeFi Education Fund, has petitioned the Trump administration to end what it claimed was the â€œlawless prosecutionâ€ of open-source software developers, including Roman Storm, a creator of the crypto mixing service Tornado Cash. In an April 28 letter to White House crypto czar David Sacks, the group urged President Donald Trump â€œto take immediate action to discontinue the Biden-era Department of Justice's lawless campaign to criminalize open-source software development.â€Â The letter specifically mentioned the prosecution of Storm, who was charged in August 2023 with helping launder over $1 billion in crypto through Tornado Cash. His trial is still set for July, and his fellow charged co-founder, Roman Semenov, is at large and believed to be in Russia. The DeFi Educâ€¦

entry.title: Mastercard links with Circle, Paxos for merchant stablecoin payments
entry.summary: Mastercard says it will allow merchants across its network to be paid with stablecoins in a partnership with payment processor Nuvei and stablecoin issuers Circle and Paxos.Â Through the venture, 150 million merchants across the Mastercard network will now have the option to receive payments in stablecoins, regardless of how a customer pays, Mastercard said on April 28. The payments giant also partnered with crypto exchange OKX for a crypto-enabled bank card, which Mastercard product chief Jorn Lambert said creates a â€œ360-degree approachâ€ where consumers can spend stablecoins and merchants can receive them. He added that the â€œmainstream use cases are clearâ€ for blockchain tech, and the company wanted â€œto make it as easy for merchants to receive stablecoin payments and for consumers to use â€¦

entry.title: Ethereum Foundation shuffles leadership, splits board and management
entry.summary: The Ethereum Foundation, which backs the development of the Ethereum blockchain, has overhauled its leadership structure to separate the responsibilities of its management team and board of directors. The board will act as the â€œsecurity council to protect the heart and soulâ€ of the foundation and set visions for Ethereum, while the new management will be focused on the strategic and operational execution of those visions, the Foundation said in an April 28 blog post. It added in an April 28 X post that Hsiao-Wei Wang and Tomasz K. StaÅ„czak were appointed as co-executive directors on March 2 to deliver on those visions â€” which are centered around championing censorship resistance, open-source innovation, privacy and security Wang and StaÅ„czakâ€™s roles took effect on April 28 with the foundatâ€¦

Bitcoin gained 10% over the past week, but overhead resistance continues to obstruct a rally to $100,000.

Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and Bitstamp shows that BTC price has been suppressed under $100,000 since early February, as shown in the chart below. BTC/USD weekly chart. Cointelegraph/TradingView Bitcoin lacks a $100K catalyst The BTC/USD pair rallied 30% from its $74,400 low reached on April 7 to trade above $95,000, a recovery fueled largely by easing US-China tariff tensions. entry.title: MetaMask to launch self-custody crypto card with Mastercard
entry.summary: Wallet provider MetaMask is launching a crypto payments card that will allow users to spend self-custodied funds, offering crypto holders additional ways to use their tokens. The new card is backed by Mastercard and is being developed in partnership with CompoSecure and Baanx, according to the company. The product uses smart contracts to execute the IRL (In Real Life) transactions, with a processing speed under five seconds. It operates on the Linea network, a layer-2 scaling solution on Ethereum. The companies marketed the self-custodied crypto card as an alternative to the potential risks associated with centralized exchanges. In February, the second-largest crypto exchange by volume, Bybit, was hacked for $1.4 billion, an event that sparked widespread consternation in the crypto space. â€¦

entry.title: Tether still dominates stablecoins despite competition â€” Nansen
entry.summary: Despite growing competition from emerging issuers, the stablecoin market remains largely dominated by a few key players. According to data from Web3 research firm Nansen, Tetherâ€™s USDt (USDT) continues to lead among US dollar-pegged stablecoins, even as competition intensifies. As of April 25, Tether has a roughly 66% market share among stablecoins, compared to around 28% for USDC (USDC), Nansen said in the April 25 report.Â Ethenaâ€™s USDe stablecoin ranks a distant third, touting a market share of just over 2%. Nansen expects Tetherâ€™s lead to endure even as rivals such as USDC clock faster growth rates. â€œWith nearly 3x as many users as Uniswap and 50+% more transactions than the next app, Tether is by and far the largest use case of onchain activity,â€ Nansen said. â€œDespite the potential dâ€¦

entry.title: Arizona legislature passes Bitcoin reserve bills, moving closer to stockpiling crypto
entry.summary: Lawmakers in the Arizona House of Representatives passed two bills that could allow the state to adopt a reserve using Bitcoin (BTC) or other cryptocurrencies. In a third reading on April 28 of Senate Bill 1025 (SB1025), a proposal to amend Arizonaâ€™s statutes to allow for a strategic BTC reserve, 31 members of the Arizona House voted in favor of the bill, with 25 opposed. A similar bill, SB1373, to establish a state-level digital assets reserve, passed with 37 lawmakers in favor and 19 voting nay. â€œThis bill basically takes the approach that probably 15 other states are considering the same legislation nationwide that allows the treasurer to invest up to 10% into, probably mainly Bitcoin but other things as well,â€ said State Representative Jeff Weninger on SB1025. â€œI think this probably wâ€¦

Two other gold-backed cryptocurrencies â€” Quorium (QGOLD) and Kinesis Gold (KAU) â€” have seen rises of 8.5% and 7.6%, respectively, in the past 30 days. All four tokens are up 40% or more in the past 12 months, CoinGecko data shows.
